Auto Screen divider
After launcher, you can click the app icon, long press and drag the app to screen in order to open this function.
Quick Setting
Long press on menu Key
Help
1. You can open this function by long press or setting in the screen-divider appliction whichever screen on. You can see the icon on screen.
2. Click on the icon, this will list all the application that this function support. You can fling on to choose the app you want.
3. Chooset the app you want, drag the icon to the screen by long pressing, the function will run when you loosen.
4. You can choose the description of pre-steps to change the app you want.
FAQ
Notification
Some apps do not support resolution ratio automatically, then dipaly problem occurs. Please contact with us, we will positive promote apps to adjust.
Q: What kind of apps support multi-window?
"A: Tap Smart Viewer floating icon and pops up a list containing all installed apps (including commonly used apps and the third-party apps) that support Smart Viewer. "
Q: Some app display overlapped in multi-window, why?
"A: A few third-party apps are unable to adjust size aotumatically, which results in above problem.You can resize multi-window to resolve this problem. "
Q: Why an app does not appear correctly when launched in multi-window?
"A: A few apps adjust depending on screen resolution, which results in above problem. You can swipe correspnding window to view or tap display mode icon to scale. "
Q: I can not launch camera or flashlight in 2 windows simultaneously, why?

"A: Most of the apps can be launched in 2 windows simultaneously. For those hardware-related apps (such as camera, radio, voice recorder or flashlight), you can only operate the app in a window, and the other window would be locked. "
Q: I can not transfer files using WeChat or other microblog apps in multi-window, why?
"A: The app itself should be able to support file transfer in multi-window. A few third-party apps do not support file transfer, therefore this function is available for some ZTE apps for now. "
Q: Why does the app icon disappear when toggling multi-window mode into floating mode?
A: We do not have corresponding apps in floating mode, therefore the app icon will automatically hide when changing to floating mode.
